titles.title: AMISH Act

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for a credit against tax, or refund of tax, for certain Federal insurance taxes for employees who are members of religious faiths which oppose participation in such insurance.
Act to exempt religious Members and Individuals from Social Security and Healthcare taxes Act
AMISH Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary:
Act to exempt religious Members and Individuals from Social Security and Healthcare taxes Act or the AMISH Act
This bill allows an employee, based on a conscientious, faith based objection, to apply for a credit or refund of deductions from that employee's wages for Social Security and Medicare taxes, provided that the employee waives all related federal benefits thereto.
